Generator

Parameter Set
.

Description
..

The microEnable IV frame grabber enables the activation or deactivation of a CameraLink generator instead of camera data. It generates image data for acquisition. The image data defines each pixel value and shows diagonal stripes within the image.

The image data can be configured concerning image size, line gap, frequency and accuracy. Additionally, it is possible to activate or deactivate some of the four taps.

The image can be moved. In this case, the image values will get higher about the value you enter at roll parameter. If the pixel values reach the maximum pixel value (255), they will start at 0.


Parameters
.

Image Source

The image source defines the source of data stream. Either it can come from camera port or it will be generated.

Normally, the data comes from camera. In cases that you like to test some features without having a camera available, it is possible to generate some image data.

This functionality is very important for tests concerning possible problems within camera or CameraLink cable.

Image Start

This parameter acitvates or deactivates the image data generation, if the image source has been set to 'Generator'.

Width

For image data generation the image width can be set. Please note that you additionally have to set the display width. The image data width just sets one dimension of the image data stream size. However the display width just sets one dimension of the image size that will be displayed within port window.

Height

The image height can be set concerning image data generation. Please note that you additionally have to set the display height. The image data height just sets one dimension of the image data stream size. However the display height just sets one dimension of the image size that will be displayed within port window.

Line Gap

The parameter line gap enables to set the number of pixels that build a gap between two lines.

Frequency

Concerning camera pixel clock, frequency sets the speed of image data generation. A value of up to 125MHz can be set for speed / stress tests e. g.

Accuracy

With accuracy / hd sync, you are able to set the period of an internal trigger signal. This signal fixes the time resolution the trigger system can be set to. Therefore, it is the accuracy the exposure and frequency of the trigger signal can be set to.

Tap 1 / Tap 2 / Tap 3 / Tap 4

Four taps can be activated at the maximum. You can choose the tap(s) that should be activated.

Roll

The generated image data can be moved. In this case, the image values will get higher about the value you enter at this parameter. If the pixal values reach the maximum pixel value (255), they will start at 0.
.
